required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of Levemir®, NovoMix® 30 and NovoRapid® in Insulin naïve Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Effectiveness and Safety of Levemir® (Insulin Detemir), NovoMix® (Biphasic Insulin Aspart) and/or NovoRapid® (Insulin Aspart) in Insulin naïve Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Europe and Asia. The aim of this observational study is to evaluate the effectiveness and the incidence of serious adverse reactions while using Levemir®, NovoMix® and/or NovoRapid® in subjects with type 2 diabetes that have not used insulin previously under normal clinical practice conditions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline visit and during 3, 6, 9 and 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Serious adverse drug reactions including major hypoglycaemic events

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of serious adverse drug reactions
Number of all major (daytime and nocturnal) hypoglycaemic events
Number of all minor (daytime and nocturnal) hypoglycaemic events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 4 weeks prior to each study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Variability in fasting blood glucose values and average (mean) fasting blood glucose level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline visit and after 6 and 12 months treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Average post-prandial blood glucose level (2h after dinner)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline visit and after 6 and 12 months treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QoL) as assessed by patient questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and the end of 6 and 12 months treatment

intervention.description: Start dose and frequency at the discretion of the physician following clinical practice
Start dose and frequency at the discretion of the physician following clinical practice
Start dose and frequency at the discretion of the physician following clinical practice

study_pop.textblock: Patients of both genders who, in practice settings, have been deemed appropriate to receive Levemir®, NovoMix® 30 or and/or NovoRapid® as new treatment and as part of routine out-patient care by the prescribing physician.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any insulin näive type 2 diabetic patient that able to use the drug as judged by the investigator
Exclusion Criteria:
- In accordance with approved label

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
Insulin aspart, insulin aspart protamine drug combination 30:70
